viber.utils.webhookhandler module¶

class viber.utils.webhookhandler.WebhookHandler(request, client_address, server)[source]¶

Bases: BaseHTTPServer.BaseHTTPRequestHandler, object

do_GET()[source]¶
do_HEAD()[source]¶
do_POST()[source]¶
log_message(format, *args)[source]¶

Log an arbitrary message.

This is used by all other logging functions.

It overrides BaseHTTPRequestHandler.log_message, which logs to sys.stderr.

The first argument, FORMAT, is a format string for the message to be logged. If the format string contains any % escapes requiring parameters, they should be specified as subsequent arguments (it’s just like printf!).

The client ip is prefixed to every message.

server_version = 'WebhookHandler/1.0'¶
verify_signature(request_data, signature)[source]¶
class viber.utils.webhookhandler.WebhookServer(server_address, RequestHandlerClass, event_queue, webhook_path, bot)[source]¶

Bases: BaseHTTPServer.HTTPServer, object

handle_error(request, client_address)[source]¶

Handle an error gracefully.

serve_forever(poll_interval=0.5)[source]¶

Handle one request at a time until shutdown.

Polls for shutdown every poll_interval seconds. Ignores self.timeout. If you need to do periodic tasks, do them in another thread.

shutdown()[source]¶

Stops the serve_forever loop.

Blocks until the loop has finished. This must be called while serve_forever() is running in another thread, or it will deadlock.
